subject: Music
title: LGBTQ+ Music and Visibility
description: A quick win: understand LGBTQ+ Music and Visibility.

hook.text: Disco, house music, and pop gave LGBTQ+ communities a space to exist when society didn't.

buildup.text: In the 1970s, disco clubs became safe havens for queer people facing widespread discrimination.

discovery.text: Artists like Freddie Mercury, Elton John, and Sylvester used music to express hidden identities.

twist.text: Disco Demolition Night in 1979 was partly a backlash against music seen as too queer and Black.

climax.text: Today, artists like Lil Nas X and Sam Smith are openly queer chart-toppers â€” progress made.

punchline.text: The dance floor accepted them before society did.

quiz.question: Why were disco clubs significant for LGBTQ+ communities?
options: They were safe spaces during a time of widespread discrimination
